action.action-desc: Mrs. Lowey (for herself and Mr. Engel) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To provide certain requirements for the licensing of commercial nuclear facilities.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Nuclear Power Licensing Reform Act of 2015.
Section 103 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C. 2133) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), by inserting , including that the facility does not pose an unreasonable threat to persons or the environment because of safety or security vulnerabilities (including vulnerability to terrorist attacks), and that there exist adequate evacuation plans for emergency events and that those plans have been approved by the relevant Federal agencies and States within 50 miles of the facility after by rule establish; and

in subsection (c), by adding at the end the following: Any such renewal shall be subject to the same criteria and requirements that would be applicable for an original application for initial construction, and the Commission shall ensure that any changes in the size or distribution of the surrounding population, or seismic or other scientific data not available at time of original licensing, have not resulted in the facility being located at a site at which a new facility would not be allowed to be built..
